results.title: Longest State of the Union? Not Quite, but Trump’s Was Long
results.abstract: President Trump delivered one of the longest State of the Union addresses in 50 years, clocking in at one hour and 20 minutes. Only Bill Clinton spoke longer.

results.title: Complaint Accuses Contractor of Underpayment at Medicare Call Centers

results.title: ‘Star Trek: Discovery’ Season 1, Episode 13: Another Death, Another Twist, Another Shrug
results.abstract: In a messy episode of “Star Trek: Discovery,” we have yet another plot twist in the mirror universe and an untimely death.

results.title: Naomi Alderman on the World That Yielded ‘The Power’
results.abstract: In her most recent novel, the author posits a pointed question: If the female body were weaponized, would men become the hunted?

results.title: Andreas Gursky Is Taking Photos of Things That Do Not Exist
results.abstract: The German photographer’s latest work includes images of digitally created scenes and spaces. Are these the works he will be remembered by?

results.title: Christo to Build Floating Structure in London’s Hyde Park
results.abstract: The trapezoidal work, called a mastaba, will be made out of 7,506 barrels and be on view this summer. Later, a much larger one is planned in Abu Dhabi.

multimedia.caption: A drawing of Christo’s “The Mastaba,” which will come to London’s Hyde Park this summer.

results.title: Hillary Clinton Reads ‘Fire and Fury’ at the Grammys
results.abstract: Mrs. Clinton read an excerpt from the tell-all book about the Trump administration as part of a sketch during the Grammy Awards broadcast.
des_facet: Fire and Fury: Inside the Trump White House (Book)
